problem.p: A thin hoop of mass \(m\) and radius \(r\) is given the angular speed \(\omega_0\) and is then dropped vertically on a horizontal surface as shown. After an initial period of slipping, the hoop begins to roll without slipping at a constant velocity.
What is the best description of the motion of the hoop before slipping ends?

choicegroup.choice: The translational speed increases while rotational speed increases
The translational speed decreases while rotational speed increases
The translational speed increases while rotational speed decreases
The translational speed decreases while rotational speed decreases

problem.p: Find the speed \(v\) of the hoop after slipping stops.
Find the amount of heat \(Q\) generated before the slipping of the hoop stops. Note: the amount of heat can be found as the difference between the initial and the final kinetic energy of the hoop.
